0.title: Rocket space junk travelling at 8,850 km/hr to hit Moon today, cause huge crater
0.article_body: A four-tonne rocket body will crash into the Moon on Friday, marking the first time that space junk is accidentally hitting lunar surface. It'll smash into a crater at a speed of 8,850 km/hr and create a crater of its own. The rocket booster, believed to be part of China's Chang'e 5-T1 mission, is expected to slam at 12.25pm GMT.

1.title: Angad is asked about his projects, I'm asked about our kids: Neha
1.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia has revealed that she went for an event with her husband actor Angad Bedi where he was asked about his next projects. "Then they looked at me and they were like, 'Aap yahan hain toh bachho ka dhyaan kaun rakh raha hai (If you are here then who is taking care of your children)?'" the actress said.

2.title: Aman Lekhi resigns as Additional Solicitor General
2.article_body: Additional Solicitor General (ASG) of India, Aman Lekhi, tendered his resignation from the post on Friday. In his resignation letter, addressed to the Union law and justice minister Kiren Rijiju, Lekhi wrote, "Tendering my resignation...at the Supreme Court with immediate effect." The senior advocate was appointed, in March 2018, after his name was cleared by the Union Cabinet.

3.title: US Navy recovers crashed F-35 fighter jet from South China Sea
3.article_body: An F-35C Lightning II aircraft that crashed while attempting to land on an aircraft carrier in South China Sea has been recovered by US Navy. The aircraft was conducting "routine flight operations" when it crashed on January 24, it said. The recovery alleviates concerns that China or Russia might reach it first and gain access to its technology, AP reported.

4.title: Suriya once said what I'm doing is not acting, just managing it: Rana
4.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati at a pre-release event for actor Suriya's upcoming Tamil film 'Etharkkum Thunindhavan' revealed that the latter told him 10 years ago that what he is doing is not acting, just managing it. "He took me in his car all over Hyderabad for four hours...His four-hour class made me Bhallaladeva, Daniel Shekar and many others," Rana said.

5.title: Calls for NATO no-fly zone in Ukraine irresponsible: Lithuania PM
5.article_body: Lithuanian PM Ingrida Simonyte said that any calls for NATO to enforce a no-fly zone in Ukraine would be "irresponsible" and could drag the military alliance into direct conflict with Russia. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has been calling for NATO and Western allies to enforce a no-fly zone over Ukraine amid Russia's ongoing invasion and aerial bombardment of its cities.

6.title: Reddit bans users from sharing links to Russia-backed RT & Sputnik
6.article_body: Reddit has banned users globally from posting links to Russian state-sponsored media outlets, including RT and Sputnik. It has also decided not to accept ads that target Russia or originate from any Russia-based entity, government or private. A Reddit admin reportedly confirmed that Reddit is blocking links to all websites that end in .ru.

7.title: Delhi HC creates 3 more courts to expedite trials of pending UAPA cases
7.article_body: Delhi High Court has created three new Additional Sessions Judge (ASJ) courts to expedite trials of pending Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) cases. It has decided to withdraw the pending cases from the designated National Investigation Agency (NIA) courts. This comes after five Courts of Metropolitan Magistrate (NI Act) were shifted to Rouse Avenue Court Complex in January.

8.title: Himachal govt lowers age limit for pension to 60 yrs; amount hiked to ₹1,500
8.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, while presenting the Budget for 2022-23 in the state Assembly on Friday, announced that the monthly old-age pension amount will be increased from ₹1,001 to ₹1,500. Thakur also announced that the age limit will also be decreased from 70 years to 60 years for availing the pension, without any income limit.

9.title: Gautam Budh Nagar DM orders probe in alleged admission scam in Navodaya school
9.article_body: The Gautam Budh Nagar district magistrate has ordered an inquiry into the alleged fraud in admissions to Class 6 of the district's lone Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya. The central government school, located in a village in Dadri, is accused of enrolling students belonging to other districts. The inquiry will be led by the school's principal and whistleblower Anil Kumar Mishra.

10.title: Fan rightly predicts Kohli's score, way of getting out in 100th Test; tweet goes viral
10.article_body: A tweet has gone viral on social media wherein a fan rightly predicted that Virat Kohli will score 45 runs in the 100th Test. The fan, in the tweet, also correctly predicted how Kohli will get out to Sri Lanka's Lasith Embuldeniya. Reacting to the tweet, Virender Sehwag tweeted, "Wow." Another user wrote, "How can someone be so accurate?"

11.title: We're not obsessed with wealth, it's boring: World's richest man Musk's brother
11.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk said in an interview that he and his brother aren't obsessed with wealth. "I do know other people...are obsessed with wealth...And that's not me...it's not my brother. It's boring," he added. Kimbal claimed Musk has "paid more taxes than any human on the planet in the history of America".

12.title: Sushmita Sen's ex-boyfriend Rohman Shawl to make his acting debut
12.article_body: Sushmita Sen's ex-boyfriend Rohman Shawl is set to make his acting debut. Confirming the development, he said, "Yes, I have shot for something. I'm going to share the details once I get a go-ahead from my producers. It's under post-production for now. Please keep me in your prayers." According to reports, Rohman has been taking acting workshops since 2017.

13.title: Rajesh Patil to be Administrator of Pune's PCMC from March 14
13.article_body: Maharashtra government has issued an order appointing Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Commissioner Rajesh Patil as the Administrator of PCMC from March 14, after the term of the present civic general body comes to an end on March 13. Patil will have sole authority to make policy and financial decisions. Patil's appointment was also in response to the delay of civic body elections.

14.title: Ukrainian President survives 3 assassination attempts in 1 week: Report
14.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has survived three assassination attempts since the Russian invasion began last week, a report said. It added that two different groups, the Wagner Group and Chechen rebels, were sent to kill Zelenskyy. Earlier, Ukrainian official Oleksiy Danilov said Russia's Federal Security Service alerted them about Chechen special forces sent to kill Zelenskyy.

15.title: BharatPe removes Ashneer Grover's profile from its website days after his exit
15.article_body: Days after his resignation as the MD and director, BharatPe has removed Ashneer Grover’s profile and photo from its website. In a statement, the company had accused Grover and his wife Madhuri Jain of misappropriating company funds to fund their lavish lifestyle. The 'About Us' page now features Co-Founder Shashvat Nakrani, CEO Suhail Sameer, Nishit Sharma, among others.

16.title: You will see me on OTT very soon: 'Mohabbatein' star Preeti Jhangiani
16.article_body: Actress Preeti Jhangiani, known for films like 'Mohabbatein' and 'Awara Paagal Deewana', said the audience will soon get to see her on an OTT platform. The actress pointed out the lack of interesting projects as her reason for absence from the industry. "I got selective and nothing great in terms of characters was coming my way," Preeti added.

17.title: Last thing you want is to create uncertainty: Hesson on coaching Kohli
17.article_body: RCB's Director of Cricket and former head coach Mike Hesson said the last thing you want to do while coaching batters like Virat Kohli, AB de Villiers is "create uncertainty" around techniques or anything else. "If you see something that's...not...right, you just observe for a while and then...ask questions because these players are great for a reason," added Hesson.

18.title: 30 people killed, 56 injured in a bomb blast at Pakistan mosque during Friday prayer
18.article_body: At least 30 people were killed and 56 others injured in a bomb blast inside a mosque in Pakistan's Peshawar on Friday, police said. "We are in a state of emergency and the injured are being shifted to the hospital. We are investigating the nature of the blast but it seemed to be a suicide attack," a police officer said.

19.title: B'luru court orders Apple to refund ₹92,000 to man for not fixing iPhone
19.article_body: Bengaluru consumer court has ordered Apple India and its service centre to give a man a new iPhone or refund equivalent money, i.e, ₹92,000, for allegedly refusing to repair his iPhone, which was under warranty. It observed the parties failed to repair the device of a genuine customer. It also ordered them to pay ₹20,000 as compensation to the man.

20.title: Kim Kardashian drops surname 'West' after being declared legally single
20.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian has dropped the surname 'West' after she was declared legally single amid her divorce with rapper Ye, formerly known as Kanye West. Kim, who married Ye nearly eight years ago, had recently filed documents to be declared single. She had filed for divorce last year in February.

21.title: Vladimir Putin is at risk of ending up in prison for war crimes: UK on Ukraine war
21.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin is at risk of ending up in prison for war crimes carried out by his forces in Ukraine, Deputy Prime Minister of the UK Dominic Raab has said. An investigation by the International Criminal Court (ICC) is currently underway, with officials reportedly already in Ukraine probing whether war crimes have been carried out there.

22.title: FIR filed against UP MLA Mukhtar Ansari's son for 'hisab kitab' remark
22.article_body: An FIR has been registered against UP MLA Mukhtar Ansari's son Abbas Ansari for his 'hisab kitab' remark. "I've told Akhilesh Yadav that no transfers...of government officials will happen for six months as 'hisab kitab' will happen with them first if Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party-Samajwadi Party alliance wins," Abbas had said. Abbas is contesting UP Assembly elections from Mau Sadar.

23.title: Never been prouder to be Ukrainian: Mila on Russia-Ukraine conflict
23.article_body: Actress Mila Kunis and her husband actor Ashton Kutcher have released a video on Instagram in which the actress said, "I have never been more proud to be a Ukrainian." "And I've never been more proud to be married to a Ukrainian," Ashton added. Mila also urged fans to help raise funds for refugees fleeing Ukraine amid the Russian invasion.

24.title: Randeep Hooda's knee surgery successful: Report
24.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda's knee surgery after sustaining an injury on the sets of his upcoming series 'Inspector Avinash' has been completed successfully, reported Free Press Journal. The actor had been shooting for an action sequence with his co-star Amit Sial. Randeep had reportedly hurt the same knee earlier while shooting 2021 film 'Radhe' which starred Salman Khan.

25.title: UP constable carries elderly woman to poll booth in his arms, video goes viral
25.article_body: Video showing a policeman carrying an elderly woman to a polling booth in his arms has gone viral online. Identified as Pawan Kumar, the policeman is posted as a constable in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur. Calling Kumar a true watchdog of democracy, UP Police tweeted they are proud of him for helping the woman cast her vote at Assembly Elections.

26.title: Don't expect Paine to play cricket in 2022: Tasmania interim coach
26.article_body: Discussing former Australia Test captain Tim Paine who is on an indefinite break from cricket following a 'sexting' scandal, interim Tasmania Tigers head coach Ali De Winter said he doesn't expect Paine to play in 2022. "Paine's obviously shattered with what's happened. His life has changed," former Australia head coach Justin Langer had earlier said.

27.title: Underwater noise pollution may cause hearing loss in turtles: Scientists
27.article_body: Underwater noise pollution caused due to shipping and offshore construction may lead to hearing loss in turtles, scientists have warned. This hearing loss can last from a few minutes to days. "Over half of turtle and tortoise species are threatened, and noise pollution is an additional stressor to consider as we work towards protecting these animals," researcher Andria Salas said.

28.title: Russian news channel staff resigns on air, walks off after saying 'no war'
28.article_body: Independent Russian television channel TV Rain suspended its operations after being asked to shut operations by authorities over its coverage of Ukraine's invasion. A video showed the staff resigning on air and walking off, after saying, "No war." The channel then played 'Swan Lake' ballet video which was also played on all Soviet channels in 1991 during the civil unrest.

29.title: Renault shares fall to lowest since Nov 2020 amid Russia-Ukraine war
29.article_body: The price of shares of French automaker Renault has fallen since last week to trade at their lowest since November 2020, amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. It has reportedly lost around a quarter of its market value after the Russian invasion and growing sanctions. Renault, which owns a majority stake in Russian automaker Avtovaz, is monitoring the situation in Ukraine.

30.title: BSF rescues 23 cattle in Assam from being smuggled to Bangladesh
30.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) rescued 23 cattle from NH-6 at Hilara area in Assam's Cachar district on Thursday. The cattle were meant to be smuggled to Bangladesh, BSF said in a statement. Recently, Director-General of BSF, Pankaj Kumar Singh, had also informed that the forces are using technologically advanced devices to stop livestock smuggling along the India-Bangladesh border.

31.title: Omicron found in 100% of COVID-19 samples in Mumbai in latest genome sequencing
31.article_body: As per the latest round of genome sequencing carried out by the BMC, Omicron variant was found in 100% of the COVID-19 samples tested from Mumbai. Of the 237 patients, 103 or 44% were unvaccinated, BMC's report states. "There is nothing to panic about. But we should continue to adhere to COVID-19-appropriate behaviour," BMC Additional Commissioner Suresh Kakani said.

32.title: NATO must change posture after Russia's invasion of Ukraine: Romania
32.article_body: Romanian Foreign Minister Bogdan Aurescu on Friday said that NATO must adapt military posture at its eastern flank to a new reality following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Romania will increase its defence spending to 2.5% from 2% of GDP starting with the next fiscal year, he added. Aurescu also mentioned the presence of Russian troops in Belarus.

33.title: Russia-backed media outlet RT America shuts down, fires most of its staff
33.article_body: Russia-backed media outlet RT America is shutting down operations and laying off most of its employees, CNN reported. T&R Productions, the production company behind RT America, attributed the decision to "cease production" to "unforeseen business interruption events" in a memo to its staff. Earlier, satellite operator DirecTV stopped carrying RT America in response to Russian invasion of Ukraine.

34.title: Denial of physical relationship in marriage is cruelty: HC while granting divorce
34.article_body: Chhattisgarh High Court has held that denial of physical relationship by one spouse to the other in a matrimonial relationship amounts to cruelty. The court allowed the plea for divorce made by the husband in this case. "Physical relationship between husband and wife is one of the important parts for healthy married life," the court stated.

35.title: Over 1.67 lakh Ukrainians entered Romania since Russian invasion
35.article_body: More than 1.67 lakh Ukrainians have crossed the Ukraine-Romania border since Russia invaded the country on February 24, border police data showed on Friday. About 1,09,687 of those have already driven or flown out of Romania. The people entered Romania through its four land border checkpoints with Ukraine and also through its checkpoints with Moldova, the data showed.

36.title: Russia planning public executions in Ukraine after cities are captured: Report
36.article_body: Russia's intelligence agency, Federal Security Service, is planning public executions in conquered Ukrainian cities in order to shatter morale, according to a European intelligence official. "[It] is also planning violent crowd control and repressive detention of protest organisers," reports said while citing Bloomberg. Russia has seized Europe's largest nuclear power plant situated in Ukraine.

37.title: Virat Kohli recalls old photo with Rahul Dravid during speech, pic goes viral
37.article_body: The old photograph with Rahul Dravid that Virat Kohli mentioned in his speech while being felicitated for his 100th Test match has gone viral. "I still have the picture in my house from my Under-15 NCA days, when I was looking at you. Today...I get my 100th Test cap from you...so indeed it has been a great journey," Kohli said.

38.title: Who is Sanjiv Kapoor, the new CEO of Jet Airways?
38.article_body: Sanjiv Kapoor, who reportedly resigned as President of Oberoi Hotels this week, will join Jet Airways as its new CEO on April 4. Kapoor, a Wharton School MBA graduate, started his airline career with Northwest Airlines in the US in 1997. He was SpiceJet's COO between 2013 and 2015 and Vistara's Chief Strategy and Commercial Officer between 2016 and 2019.

39.title: The only way to end Ukraine war is to assassinate Putin: US politician
39.article_body: US politician Lindsey Graham has called for the assassination of Russian President Vladimir Putin amid Russia-Ukraine war and said, "The only way this ends is for somebody in Russia to take this guy out." "Is there a Brutus in Russia? Is there a more successful Colonel Stauffenberg in the Russian military," he tweeted.

40.title: Pak court says Jadhav has right to fair trial, asks India to appoint lawyer
40.article_body: Pakistan's Islamabad High Court on Thursday observed that former Indian Navy officer Kulbhushan Jadhav is a human being and cannot be denied the right to a fair trial, reported Pakistan daily Dawn. The court has also asked India to appoint a lawyer for him by April 13. Jadhav was sentenced to death by a Pakistani military court in 2017.

41.title: Updating software to power Starlink via car cigarette lighters: Musk to Ukraine Vice PM
41.article_body: Responding to Ukrainian Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov, Elon Musk said SpaceX's Starlink is getting an update to reduce peak power consumption, so it can be powered from car cigarette lighters. Mobile roaming also activated to maintain a signal even while in a moving vehicle, Musk added. Fedorov had sought ideas from Musk to keep Starlink services online amid Russian invasion.

42.title: Aamir Khan told me that I must do 'Jhund': Amitabh Bachchan
42.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan has revealed that when he discussed 'Jhund' with actor Aamir Khan, the latter said that he must do the film. "And you know what happens when Aamir endorses something," the veteran actor added. Aamir had earlier called 'Jhund' one of Amitabh Bachchan's greatest films, saying that it breaks everything he has learnt in 20-30 years.

43.title: West Indies take 3 wickets in last over, defeat New Zealand in Women's World Cup opener
43.article_body: West Indies defeated hosts New Zealand by three runs in 2022 Women's World Cup opener in Mount Maunganui. West Indies put up a total of 259/9 before dismissing New Zealand for 256 runs in 49.5 overs. West Indies took three wickets in last over. This is the first time that West Indies won a women's international match in New Zealand.

44.title: Happiest day of my life: Seema shares pics from son Mayank's wedding to Sanah
44.article_body: Actress Seema Bhargava Pahwa took to Instagram to share pictures from her son Mayank Pahwa's wedding with actress Sanah Kapur, daughter of Pankaj Kapur and Supriya Pathak. "Happiest day in my life. God bless you both...feel proud to announce my son MAYANK PAHWA & SANAH KAPUR got married so so happy," she wrote. Mayank and Sanah got married on Wednesday.

45.title: US waives COVID-19 tests for Americans leaving Russia, Belarus
45.article_body: The US State Department said the country is waiving a requirement for negative COVID-19 tests from Americans leaving Belarus or Russia to travel home. "This exercise of enforcement discretion is limited to US citizens, permanent residents, and holders of valid immigrant visas who were in either country as of February 28," the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said.

46.title: Coinbase, Binance not to ban all Russians from platforms
46.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchanges Coinbase and Binance have said that they have no plans to preemptively ban all Russians from using their platforms. "We believe everyone deserves access to basic financial services unless the law says otherwise," Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said. "We are not going to unilaterally freeze millions of innocent users' accounts," Binance said.

47.title: DU to begin centenary celebration from May 1, several initiatives planned
47.article_body: The Delhi University is going to kickstart its centenary celebrations from May 1, Vice-Chancellor Yogesh Singh said. The celebrations will begin with the release of a commemorative stamp followed by other initiatives including the release of documentary films highlighting the university's history. "We will also felicitate our distinguished alumni including the unsung heroes of DU," said Singh.

48.title: Building owner arrested for death of 4 while cleaning septic tank in Pune
48.article_body: Pune Police have arrested the owner of a residential building over the death of four people after inhaling toxic gases while cleaning a septic tank. The arrest was made based on the complaint of a deceased's wife. She alleged that her husband, a watchman, was forced to enter the tank by the building owner.

49.title: 8 people can fit in place of a dead body on flight: BJP MLA on student's body in Ukraine
49.article_body: After 21-year-old student Naveen died in shelling in Ukraine, Karnataka BJP MLA Arvind Bellad said, "More space is needed to bring a dead body on flight. In the place required for a dead body, eight persons could be accommodated and brought back." "The government is putting in effort to bring back the mortal remains of Naveen," he added.

50.title: Salman Khan, Katrina Kaif's 'Tiger 3' to release on Eid 2023
50.article_body: Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif's 'Tiger 3' is set to release in theatres on Eid next year. The film, directed by Maneesh Sharma and produced by Aditya Chopra, will hit the screens on April 21. The makers also unveiled the first teaser of the action film on Friday. Salman will also make a cameo appearance in Shah Rukh Khan's 'Pathaan'.

51.title: Rajasthan CM accuses Centre of withholding funds, seeks state BJP's support
51.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has accused the BJP-led Centre of reducing the subsidy on several schemes leading to a financial burden on the state. CM Gehlot urged the state unit of BJP, which is in Opposition in Rajasthan, to take up the matter and has even proposed to send an all-party delegation from the state to New Delhi.

52.title: Paytm ex-execs' kids-focussed fintech startup Junio raises $6 mn
52.article_body: Children-focussed fintech platform Junio has raised $6 million in a funding round led by UAE-based firm NB Ventures with participation from Rajiv Dadlani Group. Founded by Shankar Nath and Ankit Gera, former senior executives of Paytm, Junio's product is a children-focussed smart card that lets them make digital and physical purchases. Junio raised $2 million in seed funding last year.

53.title: Russian soldier holding grenades walks on street in Ukraine demanding surrender
53.article_body: A video has surfaced online that showed a Russian soldier walking through a crowd in a Ukrainian street, holding two grenades, purportedly demanding them to surrender. The crowd shouted "shame" as the soldier made his way through them. It was alleged that the soldier was said to be in the city to negotiate Ukrainian surrender with the citizens.

54.title: Security forces seize explosive materials in Jharkhand's Gumla district
54.article_body: Security forces on Wednesday seized explosive materials from a forest in Gumla district of Jharkhand, a police official said. A special team comprising of district armed police and the CRPF launched a combing operation after receiving a tip-off that a Maoist had allegedly stored explosives. Officials seized 24 pieces of gelatin and 10 kg of ammonium nitrate.

55.title: Leave Ukraine or we'll f**k you up: Group claims hacking Russian space research site
55.article_body: Cybercriminals linked to Anonymous hacking group claimed to have broken into Russia's Space Research Institute's (IKI) website and leaked files allegedly belonging to the Russian space agency Roscosmos. "Leave Ukraine alone else Anonymous will f**k you up even more," the hackers wrote. Earlier, Russia denied another Anonymous-linked group's claim of disabling Russian satellite control systems.

56.title: Romanian mayor gets into verbal fight with Scindia amid students' evacuation
56.article_body: A video shows a Romanian mayor getting into a verbal spat with Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia during evacuation of Indian students who arrived from Ukraine. In the video, the mayor can be heard telling Scindia, "Explain to them (the students) when they will leave home. I provide the shelter, I provide the food and I helped them, not you."

57.title: Delhi court fines CBI ₹10,000 for not answering query in bank fraud case
57.article_body: A Delhi court has fined CBI ₹10,000 for not answering its query related to a bank fraud case. "CBI's approach is actually disappointing...They cannot ignore court's directions on the basis of their own sweet will," the court said. The case pertains to M/S Alpine Realtech Pvt Ltd and others booked on allegations that it had cheated Punjab and Sind Bank.

58.title: I found him shrewd, charismatic: Harsh Goenka on meeting Vladimir Putin years ago
58.article_body: Amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Harsh Goenka, the Chairman of RPG Enterprises, took to Twitter to recall that he met Russian President Vladimir Putin several years ago. "I found him shrewd, calm, charismatic and nationalistic. They say that the face becomes the mirror of the mind," he wrote. His tweet included an artwork showing Putin with fangs, surrounded by houseflies.

59.title: 6 barge into rented accommodation, thrash 3 women for wearing shorts in Pune
59.article_body: Six persons have been booked for allegedly barging into a rented accommodation in Pune and thrashing three women with footwear for wearing shorts. The accused also allegedly abused the complainant, who is the owner of the house, and threatened to demolish her house. The complainant alleged the accused were angry because the women wore shorts and roamed in the locality.

60.title: Stop support of SAP products till Russian tanks attack Ukraine: Vice PM to SAP
60.article_body: Ukrainian Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has asked Germany-based software firm SAP to stop support of its products in Russia instead of just stopping its sales. "We ask you to stop support of SAP products, as long as Russian tanks and missiles attack Ukraine!" he said. "Bloody invader's army continues to kill our civil population," Fedorov added.

61.title: NHRC issues notices as 4 die while cleaning septic tank in Pune
61.article_body: National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) on Friday issued notices to the Maharashtra Chief Secretary and Pune City Police Commissioner after four people allegedly died while cleaning a septic tank at a residential building in the city. "It is completely unwarranted that the poor people die for their livelihood due to lackadaisical attitude on the part of the authorities," NHRC said.

62.title: 4 booked, official suspended over destruction of rocks in Hyd's Khajaguda Hills
62.article_body: Four persons have been booked for allegedly destroying rock formations in Hyderabad's Khajaguda and also encroaching the area. Six security guards have been placed in the area to prevent further encroachment and the responsible Village Revenue Assistant has been suspended. This comes in response to an ongoing campaign by activists and heritage enthusiasts against encroachment of Khajaguda Hills.

63.title: Virat Kohli becomes 6th Indian batter to score 8,000 runs in Test cricket
63.article_body: Virat Kohli has become sixth Indian batter to score 8,000 runs in Test cricket. The 33-year-old reached the 8,000-run mark after scoring his 38th run in first innings of first Test against Sri Lanka, which marks his 100th Test. Other Indians to score at least 8,000 Test runs are Sunil Gavaskar, Sachin Tendulkar, Rahul Dravid, VVS Laxman and Virender Sehwag.

64.title: Barca Prez Laporta told me 1000 times Xavi won't be the manager: Koeman
64.article_body: Former Barcelona head coach Ronald Koeman said the club's President Joan Laporta told him a "1000 times" that Xavi would not be the team's manager as he "lacked" experience. "I still find it painful. I was not Laporta's coach. I had that feeling from the first moment after the elections there was no connection between us," added Koeman.

65.title: Greenfield airport to be set up in Arunachal Pradesh’s Hollongi
65.article_body: The Airport Authority of India has undertaken the construction of a Greenfield Airport in Hollongi, 15 Kms from Arunachal Pradesh's Itanagar. With eight check-in counters, the terminal will be able to accommodate 200 passengers during peak hours, a press release by the Ministry of Civil Aviation stated. The energy-efficient building will also be provisioned with a Rain Water Harvesting system.

66.title: I'm seeking your trust again: Macron announces re-election bid
66.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Thursday announced that he's standing for re-election. "I'm seeking your trust again. I'm a candidate to invent with you, faced with the century's challenges, a French and European singular response,'' he said in a letter to French people. If Macron succeeds, he'll be the first French President in 20 years to win a second term.

67.title: Chelsea's owner Abramovich helped pick Putin’s 1st cabinet: Piers Morgan
67.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich, British broadcaster Piers Morgan tweeted, "Memo to Chelsea fans...justifying their defence of Abramovich...: he literally helped pick Vladimir Putin's first cabinet." "That's why he won't criticise Putin," added Morgan in his tweet. "Abramovich is one of Putin's closest advisers," Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss had earlier said.

68.title: I had no chance: Eoin Morgan on going unsold in IPL mega auction
68.article_body: Having scored 133 runs in 17 matches for KKR in IPL 2021, Eoin Morgan admitted he had "no chance" after the first round in the IPL mega auction, despite leading KKR to the edition's final. "It's a fact that I have not scored enough runs," said Morgan. "I am never grateful for hard lessons," added the English cricketer.

69.title: I can only think about Chelsea with Russian owner Abramovich: Tuchel
69.article_body: Reacting to Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich's decision to sell Chelsea having bought the club in 2003, manager Thomas Tuchel said he can only think about Chelsea with Abramovich, adding that it's "very hard" for him. "It hasn't sunk in yet that this is going to stop," stated Tuchel. "Every decision he takes is the right decision," he said.

70.title: Virat Kohli has developed India's bowling strength: Gautam Gambhir
70.article_body: Talking about former Team India captain Virat Kohli, Gautam Gambhir said Kohli has "developed" India's bowling strength, adding that bowlers win you matches and batters "only" set the match up. "If you talk about Cheteshwar Pujara and Ajinkya Rahane, you have experienced players like Hanuma Vihari and Shreyas Iyer who can replace them," stated Gambhir.

71.title: Cyberpunk 2077 video game maker halts all sales to Russia & Belarus
71.article_body: Poland-based developer of video game Cyberpunk 2077, CD PROJEKT RED, is halting all sales of its products to Russia and Belarus. "The entire CD PROJEKT Group stands firm with the people of Ukraine," it said. "We do believe that commercial entities, when united, have the power to inspire global change in the hearts and minds of ordinary people," it added.

72.title: I wouldn't be the person I am if it wasn't for Rodney Marsh: Watson
72.article_body: Reacting to ex-Australia wicketkeeper Rodney Marsh's demise, Shane Watson tweeted, "I wouldn't be the person I am...if it wasn't for Rod...[He had an] amazing skill to know how to get the best out of every young cricketer." "I am absolutely shattered," added Watson in his tweet. "Australia has lost a cricketing icon and legend," read a tweet from Aaron Finch.

73.title: Petition submitted to Karnataka CM to reduce Bengaluru bus fare
73.article_body: Advocacy group Bengaluru Bus Prayanikara Vedike has submitted a petition to Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai and Transport Minister B Sriramulu for reducing bus fares and providing free service to women, transgenders and senior citizens. The petition sought ₹1,000 crore/year for Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) for this. BMTC fares are highest among all Indian cities, it claimed.

74.title: Nearly 1,000 primary schools for girls shut down in 5 years in Guj
74.article_body: As per the Socio-Economic Review report 2021-'22, around 1,000 primary schools for girls were shut down in the past five years in Gujarat. The number dropped to 1,330 in 2020-'21 from 1,429 in 2016-'17. Moreover, the enrolment of girls in primary schools slipped from 41.98 lakh to 39.80 lakh during this period.

75.title: Europe's largest nuclear power plant seized by Russian military, claims Ukraine
75.article_body: The Russian military has seized Europe's largest nuclear power plant Zaporizhzhya NPP in Ukraine, State Nuclear Regulatory Inspectorate of Ukraine said in a statement. "Operational personnel are monitoring the condition of power units," it added. Russian forces had attacked the plant on Friday morning, setting an adjacent five-storey training facility on fire.

76.title: Elon Musk warns Starlink could be 'targeted' in Ukraine, shares ways to keep caution
76.article_body: Days after SpaceX activated Starlink satellite broadband service in Ukraine, CEO Elon Musk warned there's a high probability of it being targeted amid Russia's invasion. "Starlink's the only non-Russian communications system still working in...parts of Ukraine...Please use with caution," he wrote. "Turn on Starlink only when needed and place antenna...as far away from people as possible," he said.

77.title: Ex-Pune Police Commissioner gets relief from arrest in phone tapping case till Mar 25
77.article_body: Bombay High Court on Friday granted relief from arrest to former Pune Police Commissioner Rashmi Shukla till March 25. She has filed a plea before the court seeking cancellation of the FIR against her. Police had registered an FIR against Shukla in connection with the alleged phone tapping of Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole during the previous BJP-led Maharashtra government.

78.title: Every 8th individual in India suffers from glaucoma: PGIMER doctors
78.article_body: Every eighth individual of almost 138 crore people in India suffers from or is at risk of developing glaucoma, doctors from Post Graduate Institute of Medical Education and Research (PGIMER) said on Thursday. "Glaucoma is characterised by damage to the optic nerve leading to irreversible blindness," Dr Surinder S Pandav from PGIMER said. It commonly affects people aged above 40.

79.title: Amitabh has presented my emotions perfectly: Vijay Barse on 'Jhund'
79.article_body: Vijay Barse, the man who started Slum Soccer in India, has said his "favourite actor" Amitabh Bachchan has presented his emotions perfectly in the film 'Jhund'. "It was...great experience to see Amitabh as myself on screen...I realised many times that the way he expressed Vijay Barse was exactly what I felt at that particular moment of my life," he added.

80.title: Debris falling from mountains crushes 3 U'khand women; body of 1 woman found
80.article_body: Three women were crushed by debris that fell from mountains in the Luthiyag village of Uttarakhand. The body of one of the women has been taken out, Rudraprayag District Magistrate said. Search for the two other women is underway. The victims had gone to collect gravel and concrete when the accident took place, as per reports.

81.title: US may impose sanctions on India: US diplomat as India abstains from UN vote on Russia
81.article_body: Top US diplomat Donald Lu has said that the US administration was still considering sanctions against India over the purchase of a missile defence system from Russia. His comments came after India abstained from a vote on the UN General Assembly (UNGA) resolution to condemn the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Further, Lu described India as an important security partner.

82.title: What's the big deal: Neelam on receiving botox treatment on 'Fabulous Lives...'
82.article_body: Neelam Kothari, when asked if she was comfortable getting filmed while receiving botox treatment on show 'Fabulous Lives Of Bollywood Wives', said, "I...feel...people make such a big deal of botox and...all these procedures...and I just feel 'what's the big deal?'" "You're gonna age one day and you're gonna do stuff to make yourself feel good and look good," Neelam added.

83.title: Maid held in Hyd for robbing elderly woman after blinding her with Harpic
83.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Wednesday arrested a caretaker for allegedly blinding a 73-year-old woman with Harpic and Zandu Balm and robbing her. Accused P Bhargavi was appointed as caretaker by the victim's son and had been living with her since August 2021. After applying the poisonous solution, Bhargavi robbed the victim of ₹40,000, two gold bangles and other valuables, police said.

84.title: Aviation veteran Sanjiv Kapoor appointed Jet Airways CEO
84.article_body: The Kalrock Capital and Murari Lal Jalan consortium, Jet Airways' new promoters, has appointed Sanjiv Kapoor as CEO of the airline. Kapoor, who was previously SpiceJet's Chief Operating Officer and Vistara's Chief Strategy and Commercial Officer, resigned as President of Oberoi Hotels on Thursday. "By having Sanjiv as CEO...I'm certain Jet Airways will reclaim its lost glory," Jalan said.

85.title: Airbnb is suspending all operations in Russia and Belarus: CEO
85.article_body: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky has revealed that the firm is suspending all operations in Russia and Belarus amid Russia's ongoing invasion of Ukraine. This comes days after Chesky had said US sanctions on Russian banks had affected its ability to operate within the country.  Airbnb will provide free short-term housing for up to one lakh refugees fleeing Ukraine.

86.title: 60-yr-old K'taka man enters mosque, threatens to kill religious leader; held
86.article_body: Police have arrested a 60-year-old man for allegedly trespassing into a mosque in Karnataka's Mangaluru and threatening to kill the religious leader there. A knife was seized from the two-wheeler vehicle he came in, police said. So far, it remains unclear why he threatened to kill the religious leader and more details will be available after further questioning, police added.

87.title: Russia blocks access to BBC's website, Facebook, Google Play: Report
87.article_body: The BBC's website appeared to be blocked in Russia as reports said there were problems accessing the website, hours after it brought back shortwave radio technology to cover the Russia-Ukraine war. BBC Russia's Twitter account claimed that Facebook parent Meta, Google Play Store and German public broadcaster Deutsche Welle also appeared to be blocked in Russia.

88.title: Nuclear reactors being shut down at Ukraine power plant after Russia attack: US
88.article_body: US Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm has said the reactors at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant are being safely shut down, adding that they are protected by robust containment structures. Granholm tweeted that she spoke with Ukraine's energy minister about the situation at the plant, where a fire broke out during fighting between Russian and Ukrainian forces.

89.title: Man held for killing partner in Gurugram 4 yrs after he killed her husband
89.article_body: Police arrested a 42-year-old woman's live-in partner for allegedly strangling her to death, two days after she was found dead at her house in Gurugram. The accused also confessed to murdering her husband in 2018, police said. The woman and accused had been in a relationship since 2014 and in 2018, her husband became aware of their affair, police added.

90.title: Putin's actions threaten Europe's safety: UK PM after nuclear plant fire
90.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson accused Russian President Vladimir Putin of endangering all of Europe after Russian troops attacked Europe's biggest nuclear power plant in Ukraine and sparked a fire. Johnson said that he would seek an emergency UN Security Council meeting in the coming hours over Putin's "reckless actions". The fire at Zaporizhzhia nuclear power station has been extinguished.

91.title: Who have played the most Test matches for India?
91.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli today became the 12th Indian to feature in at least 100 Test matches. Sachin Tendulkar has played the most Test matches for India (200). He is followed by Rahul Dravid (163) and VVS Laxman (134). The current BCCI President Sourav Ganguly represented India in 113 Test matches.

92.title: Ex-Australia keeper Rodney Marsh dies aged 74, seven days after suffering heart attack
92.article_body: Former Australia wicketkeeper Rodney Marsh passed away aged 74, seven days after suffering a heart attack in Queensland. He had effected 355 dismissals in Test cricket, a world record at the time of his retirement. He was also the first Australian wicketkeeper to score a Test century. He is survived by wife Roslyn and sons Daniel, Paul and Jamie.

93.title: Ali Fazal exits 'Fukrey 3' due to scheduling issues: Reports
93.article_body: Ali Fazal, who was set to star in 'Fukrey 3', has reportedly exited the project due to scheduling issues. The actor is currently shooting for Vishal Bhardwaj's 'Khufiya' and will be "busy with the thriller till March-end", a source told Mid-Day. 'Fukrey 3', starring Pulkit Samrat, Varun Sharma, Manjot Singh and Richa Chadha, went on floors on Wednesday.

94.title: Class 3 girl allegedly raped by teacher, school manager in UP
94.article_body: An eight-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her teacher and the school manager in Muzaffarnagar on Thursday. On returning home, the class 3 student narrated the incident to her father who then immediately lodged a police complaint. Circle Officer Kuldeep Singh said that the two accused have been arrested under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act.

95.title: Every household should develop its own solar tree in coming years: PM
95.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said that every household in India should develop its own solar tree that can contribute to saving up to 15% of electricity. "It'll not only be unique but will be environment-friendly," he added. "In the coming years, India's energy demands will increase, therefore, we must transition to renewable energy," PM stated.

96.title: Pune man strangles wife to death on suspicion of affair; arrested
96.article_body: A 42-year-old man was arrested in Pune on Thursday for allegedly beating and strangling his 35-year-old wife to death. The incident reportedly occurred a day before during a fight over the man's suspicion that the deceased was having an extramarital affair, according to the police. The deceased's body was sent for post mortem at Sassoon General Hospital.

97.title: Mumbai's Digha Railway Station likely to be operational by November this year
97.article_body: Around 70% of the work of Mumbai's Digha Railway Station has been completed and authorities expect to make it operational by November this year, said Ravi Agarwal, Chairman and MD, Mumbai Rail Vikas Corporation (MRVC). The station is being built under Phase-1 of the Mumbai Urban Transport Project (MUTP) 3. It will reportedly help decongest the Thane station.

98.title: 5 arrested as B'luru police bust extortion racket; ₹1.6 lakh seized
98.article_body: Bengaluru police have arrested four home guards and a man posing as a journalist for allegedly running an extortion racket. The police have also recovered about ₹1.6 lakh. The home guards reportedly would enter a spa and accuse its owner of running a prostitution racket, following which the false journalist would threaten to publish the news, a police officer said.

99.title: 92% COVID-19 deaths during third wave among unvaccinated: Govt
99.article_body: During the third COVID-19 wave, 92% of the deaths were reported among those who were unvaccinated, Director-General of Indian Council of Medical Research Dr Balram Bhargava said. "This is data from three databases with more than 94 crore population," he added. "The Indian graph is very much lower than the other countries, many of them developed countries," Bhargava further said.

100.title: Russian embassy road in Lithuania to be named 'Ukrainian Heroes Street'
100.article_body: The Lithuanian capital will name the road leading up to the Russian embassy "Ukrainian Heroes Street", Vilnius Mayor said. "Everyone who writes to the embassy will have to give a thought to the victims of the Russian aggression and about the heroes of Ukraine," Remigijus Simasius added. The city council will adopt the change on Wednesday, the mayor said.

101.title: 60-yr-old woman tries to set herself on fire outside Mantralaya in Mumbai
101.article_body: A 60-year-old woman poured kerosene on herself and tried setting herself ablaze outside the Mantralaya in Mumbai. The woman alleged that she had been framed by police in a case and demanded action against the concerned police officer. She further asked to cancel the FIR filed against her in the case.

102.title: Some contract staff stuck in Ukraine: US EV infrastructure firm CEO
102.article_body: US EV infrastructure firm ChargePoint CEO Pasquale Romano has said that around 20 of the firm's contract employees are stuck in Ukraine amid the ongoing war. He said the employees are not able to flee after the Ukrainian government banned men of ages 18 to 60 years old from leaving. He added ChargePoint is searching for ways to help them.

103.title: Singer Aditya Narayan, Shweta Agarwal blessed with a baby girl
103.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan and his actress-wife Shweta Agarwal have been blessed with a baby girl. Aditya has revealed that their daughter was born on February 24. "I have already started singing songs to her. Music is in her DNA," he added. "Shweta and I feel extremely blessed that we are parents now," he added.

104.title: Analyst toasts to 'death' of Russian stock market on TV, says 'Rest in peace, comrade'
104.article_body: With Russian stock market being closed for four straight days after the country's invasion of Ukraine, stock exchange analyst Alexander Butmanov made a "funeral" toast to the stock market live on a business TV channel. "Dear stock market, you were close to us and interesting. Rest in peace, dear comrade," he said as he opened a bottle of soda water.

105.title: Security camera video shows fire at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine
105.article_body: Mykhailo Podolyak, an advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, took to Twitter to share a security camera video of fire at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "Zaporizhzhia NPP is under fire! The entire Europe is at risk of a repeat of the nuclear catastrophe. Russians must stop fire!" he wrote.

106.title: TN proposes to send MPs, officials to countries adjoining Ukraine
106.article_body: Tamil Nadu government has proposed to send four lawmakers and four IAS officers to Romania, Poland, Hungary and Slovakia, countries that adjoin Ukraine, for evacuating over 1,000 Tamil students. State CM MK Stalin has sent the list of the team to Union Minister S Jaishankar for approval. "So far, about 193 students from Tamil Nadu have been facilitated," Stalin said.

107.title: Fire at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine extinguished
107.article_body: The fire caused by Russian shelling at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine has been extinguished, emergency services said. Earlier, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he has informed the leaders of the US, Britain, the European Union and the International Atomic Energy Agency about the threat of nuclear disaster after Russian troops shelled the nuclear power plant.

108.title: 8.5 kg heroin worth ₹60 crore seized from 2 Kenyan nationals at Guj airport
108.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has arrested two Kenyan nationals with 8.5 kilograms of heroin worth ₹60 crore at the Ahmedabad Airport in Gujarat. According to officials, the accused had hidden the narcotics in cavities inside their bags. "These passengers came to visit India on the pretext of medical visits on the basis of fabricated letters," DRI's statement said.

109.title: UK freezes assets of Russian billionaire & ex-deputy PM, imposes travel ban on them
109.article_body: The UK government has announced new immediate sanctions on two Russian oligarchs, which include a full asset freeze and travel bans. The two oligarchs are Arsenal FC's former billionaire shareholder Alisher Usmanov and Russia's former deputy PM Igor Shuvalov. "Putin associates [are] now cut off from their significant UK interests including mansions worth tens of millions," the government said.

110.title: Twitter to reopen all offices from March 15, staff can pick work from home 'forever'
110.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal announced that Twitter will reopen all its offices around the world from March 15 after nearly two years. However, he added that employees can work wherever they feel the most "productive and creative" and that includes "working from home full-time forever". They can also choose to work some days in office and some days at home.

111.title: Sensex crashes 1,050 points, Nifty below 16,200 amid Russia-Ukraine conflict
111.article_body: The Sensex tanked more than 1,050 points on Friday amid weak global cues due to the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. The Sensex was trading below 54,100 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 also fell around 320 points to trade below 16,200. Banks and auto stocks, Maruti Suzuki and Axis Bank, were among worst-hit during intraday trade.

112.title: HC seeks info from UP on meat sale ban in Mathura-Vrindavan wards
112.article_body: Allahabad High Court has sought information from Uttar Pradesh government over the ban on sale of meat and other non-vegetarian items in 22 wards under the Mathura-Vrindavan municipal corporation while hearing a petition. Last year, a state government order had declared these wards as "holy pilgrimage" sites. The petition asked the court to direct authorities not to restrict their businesses.

113.title: Allow firefighters access to Ukraine nuclear site: Biden to Russia
113.article_body: US President Joe Biden spoke to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy after a fire broke out at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine after Russian shelling, the White House said in a statement. "Biden joined President Zelenskyy in urging Russia to cease its military activities in the area and allow firefighters, emergency responders to access the site," the statement read.

114.title: Dad didn't want me to join film industry, hid an offer for months: Neelam
114.article_body: Actress and jewellery designer Neelam Kothari has revealed that her parents were not initially comfortable with her decision to forge a career in acting. "We didn't have...filmy background," she said, adding, "So I got [an] offer, but I think for months...dad didn't tell me. Because in their head it was a big capital 'NO', our daughter is never joining films."

115.title: Evacuation from Ukraine accelerating, 7,400 more Indians to return in 2 days: MEA
115.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has said the pace of India's evacuation operation from war-hit Ukraine is accelerating and around 6,400 people have been brought back under Operation Ganga so far. Over 7,400 more Indians are expected to return home over next two days, it added. Eighteen flights have been scheduled in the next 24 hours, MEA spokesperson said.

116.title: Sitaram Yechury accuses Cong of 'flirting with soft Hindutva'
116.article_body: CPI(M) general secretary Sitaram Yechury has accused Congress of "flirting with soft Hindutva" and calls it "weakened" to take on the BJP at the national level. Speaking to the press in Kochi, Yechury said, "Congress has played in tandem with the BJP against the state's LDF government." He further claimed, "A stronger Left will bring all secular forces together."

117.title: Won't allow any polls till OBC quota is restored in local bodies: Maha Min
117.article_body: Leader of the Opposition in Maharashtra Legislative Assembly Devendra Fadnavis said that BJP will not allow any elections in the state until OBC reservation is restored in all local bodies. "The Maha Vikas Aghadi government's lackadaisical approach towards the OBC reservation is shocking," he added. "It has miserably failed to safeguard the OBC reservation," Fadnavis further said.

118.title: Pete Davidson close to joining Bezos on spaceflight this yr: Report
118.article_body: US comedian Pete Davidson is close to signing a deal to join Blue Origin's Jeff Bezos on a spaceflight later this year, The New York Post reported. "They haven't signed a contract yet, but it looks like it's going to happen," a source was quoted as saying. "Star Trek" actor William Shatner rode on a Blue Origin spaceflight last October.

119.title: Around 46,750 people live on Yamuna floodplains in Delhi: Report
119.article_body: About 9,350 households with roughly 46,750 people in 56 bastis reside on the Zone O floodplains of Yamuna in Delhi, a report stated. While more than half of these people practice farming, others earn their livelihood through fishing, nurseries, daily wage labour. The report studied the floodplains along a stretch of 22 km of the river in the national capital.

120.title: Men’s lifestyle brand DaMENSCH raises ₹122.5 crore in Series B funding
120.article_body: Bengaluru-based men's fashion startup DaMENSCH has raised ₹122.5 crore in a Series B round of funding from A91 Partners. The company had previously raised ₹50 crore in Series A in November 2020. Founded by Anurag Saboo and Gaurav Pushkar, DaMENSCH aims to create premium essential wear for modern men who seek excellence in everything they do, including their apparel.

121.title: Newly appointed Mumbai Police Commissioner clears transfer of 128 officers
121.article_body: Sanjay Pandey, who was appointed as Mumbai Police Commissioner on Monday, released 128 police officers due for transfer. Pandey had ordered the transfer of around 187 police officers while he was the state's acting Director General of Police (DGP). However, they were not relieved earlier as former Police Commissioner Hemant Nagrale opposed the transfer citing less manpower in the city.

122.title: India reports 6,396 COVID-19 cases, 201 deaths in last 24 hours
122.article_body: India has reported 6,396 new COVID-19 cases and 201 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 6,561 cases and 142 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 69,897, while the death toll in the country has reached 5,14,589.

123.title: Barcelona, Real Madrid, Juventus lie more than Putin: La Liga Prez
123.article_body: La Liga President Javier Tebas said Barcelona, Real Madrid and Juventus "lie more than" Vladimir Putin, adding that the clubs want to "kill" football. "They constantly say [the European Super League]...won't affect national leagues. All the national leagues must be idiots, dumb because all of us will say it will hurt us," stated Tebas.

124.title: Kohli likes to get under the skin of bowlers like Miandad: Gavaskar
124.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, Sunil Gavaskar said Kohli likes to get under the "skin" of bowlers like ex-Pakistani cricketer Javed Miandad, adding that he is one of the rare batters who likes to sledge bowlers. "To provoke a fast bowler takes something else," stated Gavaskar. The first India-Sri Lanka Test marks Kohli's 100th Test match.

125.title: 5 private firm officials killed after car rams into truck in Bilaspur
125.article_body: Five officials of a private firm died on the spot after their car allegedly rammed into a truck on National Highway- 48 in Bilaspur on Thursday. The deceased were going for dinner after celebrating a birthday party, police said. They worked at different positions in a logistics company that provides logistical support in the supply chain to e-commerce firms.

126.title: If nuclear power plant explodes, that will be end for Europe: Ukraine President
126.article_body: After Russian troops shelled Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine, the country's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "If there is an explosion – that's the...end for Europe." "Do not allow death of Europe from a catastrophe at a nuclear power station," he added. Earlier, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba tweeted that fire has broken out at the plant.

127.title: Mamata killer of democracy, supports Rohingya Muslims: Union Min
127.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh on Thursday reacted to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee being shown black flags amid chants of 'Jai Shri Ram' in Varanasi, saying, "Why..people of Uttar Pradesh won't be angry with her? She always supports Rohingya Muslims and terrorists." He added that Mamata is a "killer of democracy".  'Jai Shri Ram' chants "irritate" Mamata, he further said.

128.title: At least 7 dead, several injured in explosion at house in Bihar's Bhagalpur
128.article_body: At least seven persons died and several others were injured in an explosion at a house in Bihar's Bhagalpur on Thursday late night, police said. "Prima facie, it is coming to light that the family was involved in making firecrackers. Around two to three houses were damaged," Bhagalpur DM said. The injured persons were admitted to a local government hospital.

129.title: US imposes full blocking sanctions against Putin's spokesperson, 7 Russian elites
129.article_body: The US announced new full blocking sanctions against seven Russian elites and President Vladimir Putin's spokesperson Dmitry Peskov, calling him a "top purveyor of Putin's propaganda". It also imposed visa restrictions on 19 oligarchs and their families. One of Russia's richest men Alisher Usmanov's property has been blocked from use in US, including his superyacht, which Germany seized recently.

130.title: Virat Kohli felicitated at start of his 100th Test, Anushka Sharma attends ceremony
130.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli was felicitated at the start of the first India-Sri Lanka Test in Mohali, which marks his 100th Test match. Team India head coach Rahul Dravid presented Kohli with a special cap to mark the occasion, while Kohli's actress-wife Anushka Sharma attended the ceremony. Kohli is the 12th Indian to feature in 100 Test matches.

131.title: Heroin worth ₹6 cr extracted from woman's body over 12 days in Rajasthan
131.article_body: As many as 88 capsules containing 862 grams of heroin worth ₹6 crore were extracted from a woman's body at a hospital in Rajasthan over a period of 12 days, officials said. The woman, a Sudan national, had swallowed some capsules and concealed others in her private parts. She had arrived at Jaipur airport from UAE's Sharjah on February 19.

132.title: Prabhas says he feels uncomfortable doing kissing scenes and removing shirt
132.article_body: Actor Prabhas, who will next be seen in the romantic-drama 'Radhe Shyam', said in an interview that he's not comfortable in filming intimate scenes for his movies. "I get uncomfortable with kissing scenes and removing my shirt," he said. "I check how many people are there on sets and say let's go and do somewhere else," Prabhas further said.

133.title: Saudi Crown Prince offers war mediation in call with Putin
133.article_body: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, during a phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday, offered to make efforts to mediate talks between Moscow and Kyiv as Russia continues its invasion of Ukraine. The Saudi leader also reiterated his support for the OPEC group of oil producers, which includes Russia, to stabilise oil markets, state media reported.

134.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 3 in fake medical registration certificates scam
134.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Thursday busted a fake medical registration certificate scam and arrested three persons. According to police, two of the accused, who completed their MBBS from China, had planned to get the certificates illegally after failing the screening test in India. They were helped by a state medical council staff, who charged ₹9 lakh for each certificate, police added.

135.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st Test against Sri Lanka
135.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bat first in first Test against Sri Lanka at the IS Bindra Punjab Cricket Association Stadium in Mohali. India's playing XI features Hanuma Vihari, Jayant Yadav and Mohammad Shami. Virat Kohli is featuring in his 100th Test, while Rohit is leading India in a Test for the first time.

136.title: Google suspends all ad sales in Russia amid invasion of Ukraine
136.article_body: Google announced that it has suspended all ad sales in Russia, a ban that covers search, YouTube and outside publishing partners, amid Ukraine's invasion citing "extraordinary circumstances". "The situation is evolving quickly, and we will continue to share updates," it said. Earlier, Russia had reportedly told Google not to show YouTube ads with "false political information" about Ukraine.

137.title: 2 held for assaulting 40-yr-old man to death in Delhi's Sadar Bazar
137.article_body: Police arrested two suspects after a 40-year-old man was assaulted to death by three men in Delhi's Sadar Bazar. The prime suspect is absconding and is suspected to have fled to his native place in Nepal, police said. "The prime suspect was enraged with the victim and his family...they had assaulted him and his father over a quarrel," police added.

138.title: 2 farmers booked for planting banned opium poppies in farmland in Pune
138.article_body: Pune Rural Police has booked two farmers from Indapur for allegedly planting banned opium poppies in their farmland. According to police, the accused had illegally planted banned opium poppies in between groundnut and garlic plants in their farmlands. Police seized 1,100 opium poppy plants worth around ₹2.11 lakh from the farmlands during a raid.

139.title: He has refused to stop attacks on Ukraine: Macron after call with Putin
139.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron said that he spoke to Russian President Vladimir Putin over the phone, and he has "refused to stop his attacks on Ukraine at this point". "It is vital to maintain dialogue to avoid human tragedy. I will continue my efforts and contacts. We must avoid the worst," Macron said in a Twitter post.

140.title: 4 women rescued as Pune police bust sex racket; 1 arrested
140.article_body: Pune City Police have rescued four women, including an Uzbekistan national, as they busted an alleged sex racket, a press release said on Thursday. A 28-year-old purported agent has been arrested by the police. The police team had set a trap in Sakore Nagar following a tip-off and arrested the accused who'd arrived there with the women in an autorickshaw.

141.title: 3 students from Nashik drown at Palghar beach while trying to save 13-yr-old boy
141.article_body: Three college students from Nashik, all aged 17 years, drowned while trying to save a 13-year-old boy at Kelwa beach in Palghar, police said. The students had come to the beach for a picnic. The 13-year-old boy also drowned in the incident. Another student, who was also pulled in by strong currents of the sea, was saved by local fishermen.

142.title: Indian student shot at in Ukraine: Union Minister VK Singh
142.article_body: Union Minister VK Singh told ANI, "I received information that an [Indian] student coming from Ukraine's Kyiv was shot at and was taken back midway." "We're trying for maximum evacuation with minimum loss," he further said. Earlier, a 21-year-old Indian student named Naveen Shekharappa was killed in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv.

143.title: Ukraine Foreign Minister shares pic of 9-storey residential building after missile attack
143.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has shared a picture of a completely burnt nine-floor apartment building in Borodyanka, Kyiv after it was destroyed following a missile attack by Russia. He tweeted, "Each time when Russian liars say they don’t drop bombs on Ukrainian cities...show this photo...Russians bombed the town for two days...killing many civilians. Stop barbaric Russia now."

144.title: Indian news anchor shouts at wrong guest on live TV for 2 minutes, video goes viral
144.article_body: A video of a news channel's debate on Ukraine crisis went viral after the anchor shouted at a guest for two minutes before realising he was shouting at the wrong person. Mistaking Ukrainian panellist Bohdan Nahaylo as American panellist Daniel McAdams, the anchor said, "Don't lecture us Mr McAdams." Moments later, McAdams said, "I'm Mr McAdams...so stop yelling at me!"

145.title: UK's richest woman Denise Coates earns $400 million in a year from her betting company
145.article_body: Denise Coates, the 54-year-old Founder and CEO of Bet365, received £300 million ($400 million) in pay and dividends in a year despite a salary cut, according to a filing by the online bookmaker. The UK's richest woman has earned more than $1.8 billion over the past decade, according to Bloomberg. Her salary makes her one of the world's best-compensated bosses.

146.title: K'taka HC bans protests, rallies in B'luru except at Freedom Park
146.article_body: Karnataka High Court on Thursday directed the state government to ensure that no protests or processions take place in Bengaluru except at Freedom Park. This comes after Congress' Mekedatu Padayatra caused traffic disruption in the city for the past few days. "It took us one hour to get to...High Court. How're regular people supposed to get around?" the bench said.

147.title: AAP MLA from Delhi sustains serious injuries in road accident in UP
147.article_body: An Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA from Delhi, Akhilesh Pati Tripathi, on Thursday sustained serious injuries in a road accident in Uttar Pradesh, the party said. His car overturned on the Lucknow-Agra Expressway in Unnao while he was returning from the Assembly poll campaigning. Tripathi, an MLA from Delhi's Model Town, was rushed to a hospital in Lucknow for treatment.

148.title: Fire breaks out at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine after Russia attack
148.article_body: Russian shelling has led to a fire at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "Russian army is firing from all sides upon Zaporizhzhia NPP...If it blows up, it will be 10 times larger than Chernobyl! Russians must immediately cease the fire, allow firefighters, establish a security zone," Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba tweeted.

149.title: I'm no good at networking: Sushmita Sen on not getting Bollywood roles
149.article_body: Sushmita Sen in a recent interaction with film critic Sucharita Tyagi, talked about her absence from acting for almost 10 years. Speaking about how she found it hard to get roles upon her return, the actor said, mainstream Bollywood wasn't offering her what she wanted. "Maybe I wasn't putting myself out there...I am no good at networking," she added.

150.title: 45-year-old man arrested for raping street dog in Mumbai
150.article_body: A 45-year-old man was arrested by the Ambernath Police in Mumbai on Thursday for allegedly raping a street dog. "The incident was witnessed by a social worker and a family staying near the accused. They saw the dog in a bad condition and took it immediately to a hospital," a police official said, adding that the dog is stable.

151.title: 7-yr-old girl out to play sexually assaulted by 23-yr-old man in Pune
151.article_body: A 23-year-old man allegedly sexually assaulted a seven-year-old girl while she was playing near a bus stand in Pune. An investigation revealed that the man forcibly took the girl to the corner of the bus stand and allegedly assaulted her. "The people in the area caught him, when the girl raised an alarm," a police official was quoted as saying.

152.title: Mumbai man breaks traffic police's e-challan machine after being fined
152.article_body: A 26-year-old two-wheeler rider allegedly broke the e-challan machine of traffic police in Mumbai. A policeman had reportedly penalised him for jumping signal, following which he snatched the machine from his hands and threw it on the ground and fled away. However, he was later arrested and presented before the court, which remanded him to police custody for two days.

153.title: Can't promote drunkenness: Delhi govt on order stopping discount on liquor
153.article_body: Delhi government has told Delhi High Court that the national capital "couldn't become a city for promoting drunkenness through discounts on liquor." The giving of discounts by liquor vends was an attempt by a few to "monopolise" the whole system, it added. It comes as private liquor sellers challenged Delhi government's order which barred them from giving discounts on alcohol.

154.title: Russia, Ukraine agree on humanitarian corridors to evacuate civilians
154.article_body: Following the second round of negotiations between Russia and Ukraine, Russia has agreed on humanitarian corridors to evacuate civilians, a Ukrainian official said. "Unfortunately, the results Ukraine needs are not yet achieved," tweeted Ukraine's presidential advisor Mykhailo Podolyak. The other key issues on the agenda were immediate ceasefire and armistice.

155.title: 19 COVID-19 cases reported at German football club FSV Mainz 05
155.article_body: German club FSV Mainz 05 on Thursday said there were 19 confirmed COVID-19 cases amongst the first-team, including players, coaches and staff. Mainz said everyone involved in the first-team is "completely immunised", adding Thursday's team training session was cancelled and players who tested negative trained individually. Mainz's Bundesliga match on Sunday against Borussia Dortmund is in doubt.

156.title: Mumbai RPF's crime prevention team nabs 2 robbers; seizes phone, cash
156.article_body: The crime prevention team of RPF Central Railway Mumbai division nabbed two robbers on Tuesday. The incident happened at the railway yard of LTT when both accused beat up a passenger and tried to escape after robbing him of cash, his phone and charger. The two accused, Ganesh Telange, 23, and Ganesh Kewat, 18, accepted their crime during preliminary investigation.

157.title: Told mother I'll think about marriage after Baahubali: Prabhas
157.article_body: Actor Prabhas, while talking about his work and family, said that his family has been pressurising him to "get married and have kids". The 42-year-old further said that he'd told his mother he'll think about marriage after his  film 'Baahubali'. He shared that while he too wishes to settle down, he feels that "it'll happen at the right time".

158.title: Actor Randeep Hooda gets hurt during shoot, undergoes knee surgery
158.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda on Wednesday underwent knee surgery at a Mumbai hospital after sustaining an injury on the set of his upcoming series 'Inspector Avinash'. The actor reportedly suffered the injury while filming a combat sequence for the series in February. A source close to the actor informed that he hurt the same knee he had injured while filming 'Radhe'.

159.title: 2 Tripura students return from Ukraine, felicitated by CM Biplab Deb
159.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb on Thursday met with two students who reached the state safely from Ukraine. The CM felicitated both the students and thanked PM Narendra Modi for his efforts to evacuate Indian students from Ukraine. Responding to questions regarding the number of Tripura students stuck in Ukraine, the CM said that exact figures weren't available.

160.title: Tens of millions of lives at risk in Ukraine: UN Human Rights Chief
160.article_body: The UN Human Rights Chief Michelle Bachelet on Thursday said tens of millions of lives are at risk in Ukraine as Russia continues its invasion of the country, which began last week. Ukraine's First Deputy Foreign Minister Emine Dzhaparova said Russian troops fighting in Ukraine "systematically engage in acts that clearly amount to war crimes and crimes against humanity".

161.title: 'I don't bite,' says Ukraine President as he asks Putin to 'sit down' for negotiation
161.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has asked his Russian counterpart Putin to "sit down" for negotiation amid the ongoing war between both the countries. "I don't bite. What are you afraid of?" Zelenskyy further said. "Words are more important than shots," he added while stating that it was sensible to have talks.

162.title: It was nice to meet you, jokes Pak's Fakhar as fan shares 'long distance' selfie
162.article_body: Pakistan batter Fakhar Zaman took to Twitter to react to a 'long distance' selfie taken by a fan from the stands during a Pakistan Super League match. In the picture, Fakhar is not clearly visible as he was near the boundary rope. Commenting on the picture, Fakhar wrote, "It was nice to meet you."

163.title: 249 civilians dead, 553 injured in Ukraine: UN Human Rights Office
163.article_body: The UN Human Rights Office on Thursday said it has confirmed that 249 civilians have died and 553 have been injured in Ukraine since Russia's invasion began last week. However, Ukraine's emergency service on Wednesday said over 2,000 civilians have been killed so far. The UN Human Rights Office added it believes the true death toll is "considerably higher".

164.title: Sit down with me, just not at 30 metres: Ukraine President to Russia's Putin
164.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday called for Russian President Vladimir Putin to "sit down" with him for negotiation. "Sit down with me to negotiate, just not at 30 metres," Zelenskyy said. Reports said he was apparently referring to recent photos of Putin sitting at one end of an extremely long table when he met with French President Emmanuel Macron.

165.title: Rahul shares video of student criticising govt on return from Ukraine
165.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday shared a video of an Indian female student who criticised the government's evacuation process from Ukraine. Rahul said evacuation is a duty and not a favour. "We are brought back on a flight from Romania, which is a safe country. So how can you call this evacuation?" the student had said in the video.

166.title: 34-yr-old kills his father in Goa for rejecting marriage proposals
166.article_body: A 34-year-old man killed his father in Goa after blaming him for rejecting marriage proposals. The accused, identified as Rajesh Gaonkar, attacked his 65-year-old father Ganesh Gaonkar with an iron rod. Police said the murder's cause was understood to be constant bickering with his father over marriage and his father not letting him get married.

167.title: CBI refutes Indrani Mukerjea’s claim that Sheena Bora is alive
167.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has refuted former media executive Indrani Mukerjea's claim that her daughter Sheena Bora is alive and residing in Srinagar. Responding to Mukerjea's plea for an investigation of the claim, the agency said, "The plea filed by Mukerjea is frivolous, in which wild claims are made that are not sustainable."

168.title: IPO-bound LIC appoints insurance veteran Sunil Agrawal as CFO: Reports
168.article_body: LIC has appointed former Reliance Nippon Life Insurance CFO Sunil Agrawal as the IPO-bound insurer's CFO, Bloomberg reported. Agrawal served as Nippon's CFO for 12 years till 2018. Prior to that, he worked for ICICI Prudential Life Insurance for five years. He replaced LIC Executive Director Shubhangi Soman and is the first outsider to be appointed to the position.

169.title: Over 97% of adults have received 1st COVID-19 vaccine dose: Govt
169.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya tweeted on Thursday that over 97% of India's adult population has received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. "Rapidly marching towards achieving 100% first dose mark," he added. Notably, at a press meet today, ICMR's Dr Balram Bhargava said the first dose of vaccine is 98.9% effective in preventing mortality.

170.title: Chelsea reach FA Cup quarters as Abramovich announces club is up for sale
170.article_body: Hours after Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich announced he is putting the club up for sale, Chelsea beat Luton Town 3-2 to reach the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. Chelsea's £97.5 million record signing Romelu Lukaku scored the winning goal in the fifth-round match. Abramovich has owned the London-based club for nearly 20 years. Chelsea were FA Cup finalists last year.

171.title: Liverpool beat Norwich City 2-1 to reach FA Cup quarter-finals
171.article_body: Liverpool's Takumi Minamino on Wednesday scored twice to help Liverpool beat Norwich City 2-1 and reach the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. Liverpool beat Chelsea on penalties to win the Carabao Cup on Sunday. "Takumi is an incredible player and tonight was the best game he had for us. He was a constant threat throughout," Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said.

172.title: If you can't close the skies, then give me planes: Ukraine President to the West
172.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called on the West to increase military aid to Ukraine and said, "If you do not have the power to close the skies, then give me planes!" "If we (Ukraine) are no more then, God forbid, Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia will be next. Believe me," Zelenskyy warned.

173.title: Delhi reports 326 COVID-19 cases, 3 deaths in last 24 hrs
173.article_body: Delhi reported 326 new COVID-19 cases and three related deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,60,887.
