"We need to focus on Make in India, need to manufacture sustainable and qualitative products," PM Modi added. "We have to become self-reliant in the production of semiconductors. Make in India is the demand of the time," PM Modi stated.

348.title: Amazon, Future Group agree to hold talks to settle 18-month long legal dispute
348.article_body: During a Supreme Court hearing on Thursday, Amazon and Kishore Biyani-led Future Group agreed to initiate talks for an out-of-court settlement of the 18-month long legal dispute between the two. "No one is winning. FRL, Reliance and Amazon all have issues," Future Group's counsel Harish Salve said. The court granted them 10 days to explore settlement.

349.title: Shanaya, Lakshya to make their B'wood debut with Karan Johar's Bedhadak
349.article_body: Actors Lakshya and Shanaya Kapoor will make their Bollywood debut with the upcoming film 'Bedhadak'. The film's producer Karan Johar on Thursday made the announcement on his social media handles. Sharing the first poster of the film featuring Shanaya, Karan Johar wrote, "Introducing the gorgeous Shanaya Kapoor...I can't wait to see the energy she brings onto the screen!"

350.title: Kim Kardashian declared legally single amid divorce with Kanye West
350.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian has been declared legally single amid her divorce with rapper Ye, formerly known as Kanye West. In a virtual court hearing on Wednesday, Kim also officially and legally dropped 'West' from her last name as part of the bifurcated divorce proceedings. Issues of child custody and property are yet to be worked out.

351.title: Student shares sexually explicit morphed pics of university faculty in Punjab, held
351.article_body: Punjab Police have arrested a student for circulating sexually explicit morphed photos of faculty members of a private university. The accused was identified as Mohali resident Navjosh Singh Atwal. Atwal revealed he used to download porn material and then morphed the downloaded video content with photos of faculty members to circulate them by creating fake WhatsApp accounts using VPN.

352.title: Who is Fedorov, Ukraine's youngest minister urging tech firms to act against Russia?
352.article_body: Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov has been calling on big tech companies, including Apple, Google and Meta, to completely isolate Russia amid its invasion of Ukraine. The 31-year-old, who is Ukraine's youngest minister, had managed Volodymyr Zelenskyy's digital campaign in 2019 and it was so successful that Zelenskyy became President, reports said. Prior to politics, he ran a marketing agency.

353.title: China is provoking India at every turn: US diplomat Donald Lu
353.article_body: US' Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asia, Donald Lu, said China is provoking India at every turn just as it is challenging US. Lu cited China selecting the regiment commander responsible for attack on Indian border as torchbearer at Winter Olympics in Beijing. Lu added US is working with India on bolstering its defence capabilities.

354.title: You're counting sips of water before off-shirt scene: Robert on 'The Batman'
354.article_body: 'The Batman' actor Robert Pattinson said "you're counting sips of water" before scenes with "your shirt off". Talking about how he had to watch what he was consuming before shirtless scenes, he said, "You just cut down and cut down and cut down." "I had three months before movie started...then you're working out before...after work all the time," he added.

355.title: Oracle suspends operations in Russia, SAP pauses sales
355.article_body: Oracle said it has suspended all operations in Russia, while SAP announced it will pause all sales, after Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov wrote letters to them requesting to end services to Russia. In response to Fedorov's request, Oracle said it had "already suspended all operations". SAP called sanctions against Russia "an important mechanism" in efforts to restore peace.

356.title: Chahar is slightly ahead of Bhuvneshwar for place in T20 WC squad: Irfan
356.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said pacer Deepak Chahar is slightly ahead of Bhuvneshwar Kumar for a place in India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "Bhuvneshwar has been doing well in the past few games, but when it comes to batting, Chahar has improved a lot. On that basis, I think he's ahead," Irfan explained.

357.title: Maharashtra Guv leaves Assembly midway amid slogan shouting
357.article_body: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari left the Vidhan Bhavan without completing his address to the joint session of the Houses amid slogan-shouting by MLAs. State Minister Jayant Patil claimed that MVA shouted slogans in praise of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, while BJP legislators raised "low level" slogans. The Governor had allegedly made controversial remarks over Shivaji Maharaj recently.

358.title: TIME magazine cover features Zelenskyy's quote, Ukraine calls it 'historic'
358.article_body: TIME magazine unveiled the cover of its upcoming edition. The cover image features the words spoken by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a speech addressed to European Parliament. The quote reads, "Life will win over death, and light will win over darkness." The official Twitter account of war-ridden Ukraine called the cover "historic".

359.title: Man, woman beaten up over alleged love affair in Raj
359.article_body: A man and a married woman were assaulted in Rajasthan's Ukheri over suspected love affair. The complainant alleged he went to a house in the village to ask for water when two men locked him inside. They, later, tied him to a wooden post with a woman present inside the house and beat them up, suspecting an affair between them.

360.title: Mukesh Ambani's $89.9 bn fortune nearly equals Russia's 4 richest men combined
360.article_body: India's richest person and Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani currently has a net worth of $89.9 billion, which is nearly equal to that of Russia's four richest billionaires combined. Russia's richest man Vladimir Potanin has a net worth of $25.2 billion, as per Bloomberg, while Severstal's ex-CEO Alexey Mordashov and Novatek Founder Leonid Mikhelson's fortunes stand at $22 billion each.

361.title: Police seize opium from vehicle registered in NPP MLA’s name in Manipur
361.article_body: Police said around 34 kg of opium was seized by Narcotics and Affairs of Border (NAB) from a vehicle registered in the name of National People's Party's (NPP) MLA Langpoklakpam Jayantakumar Singh in Manipur on Wednesday. The driver of the vehicle was arrested. During interrogation, the accused confessed that he is an inter-state drug trafficker.

362.title: Ukraine explains why it was invaded by Russia
362.article_body: In a post on its official Twitter handle, Ukraine shared a link explaining why it was invaded by Russia. "Russian President Vladimir Putin has spared no effort to promote the false historical narrative that Ukrainians and Russians constitute 'one nation'," Ukraine said. "Putin cannot tolerate core values and DNA of Ukrainian society...so he is seeking to destroy them," Ukraine added.

363.title: Nissan ex-exec gets 6-month suspension for helping ex-CEO hide pay
363.article_body: Former Nissan executive Greg Kelly has been given a six-month suspended sentence for helping former CEO Carlos Ghosn hide pay from financial regulators, in Tokyo. A judge suspended Kelly's sentence for three years in his ruling on Thursday, ending months of trial proceedings. The two executives were arrested in Tokyo in November 2018 and charged with various financial misconduct offences.

364.title: 4 killed, 2 children injured as SUV rams into houses in Andhra Pradesh
364.article_body: Four people were killed and two children sustained injuries when an SUV travelling at a high speed lost control and rammed into their houses in Andhra Pradesh's Kadapa district on Wednesday, police said. The victims were relaxing on their cots in front of their houses, police added. "The children are out of danger...their condition is stable," police further said.

365.title: Don’t let COVID-19 vaccine doses get wasted: Centre writes to states, UTs
365.article_body: The Centre has asked the states and union territories to ensure that COVID-19 vaccine doses do not get wasted in private or government vaccination centres due to expiry. In a letter, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare noted that "earlier also directions have been issued to specific states of West Bengal, Karnataka, Kerala and Maharashtra" in this regard.

366.title: They need outlet: Official on wellness session for Kamathipura sex workers
366.article_body: India Post held wellness session for sex workers of Kamathipura in Mumbai. Session reportedly focused on healthy meals and importance of sharing personal problems. It lasted for over three hours. "They need outlet...A heart-to-heart conversation...I decided to start programme to make them feel comfortable in reaching out to government as they do with NGOs," Postmaster General Swati Pandey said.

367.title: Leopard skin seized during search operation in Odisha, 1 arrested
367.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of the Odisha Police seized leopard skin and arrested one person on Wednesday. The search operation was conducted with the help of Ramgiri forest officials in the Gajapati district, a senior STF official said. "The accused has been detained and handed over to Ramgiri forest officials for necessary legal action," the official added.

368.title: 'The Batman' makers unveil film's special video on Burj Khalifa, video surfaces
368.article_body: The makers of the movie 'The Batman' unveiled a special video of the film on the Burj Khalifa in Dubai. The text in the video said, "It's not just a signal, it's a warning. Unmask the truth." The text was followed by images from the film's trailers. "Our favourite Caped Crusader has taken over #BurjKhalifa," Warner Bros Pictures wrote on Instagram.

369.title: Amazon CEO pledges logistics, cybersecurity support for Ukraine
369.article_body: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy in a tweet pledged the firm's support to Ukraine saying the firm is using its logistics capability to get supplies to those in need and cybersecurity expertise to help governments and companies. "Amazon stands with the people of Ukraine, and will continue to help," he said, calling the situation in Ukraine "deeply concerning".

370.title: What could be better for Kohli's 71st hundred than his 100th Test: Jaffer
370.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that there can't be a better opportunity for Virat Kohli to score his next hundred than the occasion of his 100th Test in Mohali against Sri Lanka. Kohli hasn't scored a century in international cricket since November 2019. "We all are eagerly waiting to see the old Virat," Jaffer added.

371.title: Police to contact ordnance factories to trace explosives found in Gurugram house
371.article_body: The police have decided to contact various ordnance factories in order to trace the origin of explosives found in a vacant house in Gurugram Sector 31. "We will be writing to ordnance factories in Khagaria (MP), Muradnagar (UP) and Sivakasi Fire Factory in Tamil Nadu, which manufacture these kinds of ammunition to identify their probable buyers," the police said.

372.title: Voter turnout will be historic in Purvanchal region: BJP's Ravi Kishan
372.article_body: As polling for the sixth phase of UP Assembly polls began on Thursday, BJP MP from Gorakhpur, Ravi Kishan, said that the voter turnout will be historic in the Purvanchal region. "We will win all nine seats in Gorakhpur mandal…BJP will get over 300 seats," Kishan added. "The people of UP have decided to establish Ram Rajya here," Kishan stated.

373.title: Man punches 7 Asian women in US in span of 2 hours; arrested
373.article_body: New York Police have arrested and charged a man for allegedly punching seven Asian women in separate attacks in the span of just over two hours. The assaults reportedly took place on Sunday night from 6:30 to 8:37 pm in Manhattan. The victims were aged between 19 and 57, and they were attacked without any provocations, police said.

374.title: Vladimir Putin's statue removed from a museum in Paris, pics surface
374.article_body: Grevin Museum in Paris has removed the wax figure of Russian President Vladimir Putin in protest against Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Today it is no longer possible to present a character like him...for the first time in the museum's history we are withdrawing a statue because of historical events currently under way," museum director Yves Delhommeau said.

375.title: I don't talk Hindu-Muslim, our party doesn't discriminate: Rajnath Singh
375.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that BJP doesn't discriminate against people on the basis of caste or religion. "I don't talk about Hindu-Muslims, I don't believe in it. I don't see differences between Hindu, Muslim, Christian, or any religion. Our party doesn't differentiate between people in the name of religion," he said when asked about BJP's alleged anti-minority image.

376.title: Director Milap Zaveri loses 32 kg in less than a year, shares pic
376.article_body: Filmmaker Milap Zaveri lost around 32-kg weight in less than year. He took to Twitter to share a picture of himself and revealed that he now weighs 98.6 kg. In an interview with Hindustan Times, he revealed that he had started his weight loss journey in July last year when he weighed around 130 kg.

377.title: China asked Russia to delay Ukraine invasion until after Olympics: Report
377.article_body: A Western intelligence report indicated that Chinese officials asked Russian officials not to invade Ukraine until after the Beijing Olympics ended, NYT reported citing US officials. However, it didn't indicate that the country's Presidents Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping discussed a possible invasion when they met during Olympics on Feb 4. These claims are "speculations", a Chinese official said.

378.title: EV charging stations in Russia display 'Putin is d***head' as Ukraine firm hacks them
378.article_body: Electric vehicle charging stations on a Russian motorway were hacked by a Ukrainian company with a message reading "Putin is a d***head". "Glory to Ukraine / Glory to the heroes / Death to the enemy," other messages read. The Ukrainian company, that provided parts for the chargers, hacked them using a backdoor in the chargers' control systems.

379.title: 22-yr-old drowns in Gujarat dam while taking selfie, police finds phone with last videos
379.article_body: A 22-year-old man drowned while taking a selfie near Kakrapar dam in Gujarat's Surat district on Tuesday. The deceased was identified as Hitesh Rabari, a native of Banaskantha. Hitesh had gone to Kakrapar dam along with his three friends. Police said the deceased's mobile phone was recovered which contains his selfie videos taken before the incident.

380.title: 12th edition of Bengaluru India Nano to be held from March 7-9
380.article_body: The 12th edition of the three-day-long Bengaluru India Nano event with 'Nanotech for Sustainable Future' as its central theme will be held from March 7-9, said Karnataka Minister Dr Ashwathnarayan CN. Over 10 countries and 2,500 registered delegates will be participating in the summit which will have over 40 companies showcasing its nanotech products, services, and innovation and poster sessions.

381.title: Mumbai Police Commissioner shares personal mobile number on Facebook
381.article_body: In a move to maintain law and order in the city, the newly appointed Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey shared his personal mobile number on Facebook and asked people to contact him directly to share their suggestions. "Suggestions big or small are all welcome...I too will share with you what work we are doing on a weekly basis," he said.

382.title: They started blowing the trumpet: Shantanu on parents' reaction to 'Gangubai...'
382.article_body: When asked about his parents' reaction to his film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', actor Shantanu Maheshwari said, "Honestly, I had just told them that I'm part of the film but [I] didn’t...give much details." "They went to watch the film on Friday, and fir toh dhindora peetne lage (they started blowing the trumpet)...They asked everyone around them to watch it," he added.

383.title: Congress doing politics on Indians stranded in Ukraine: Naqvi
383.article_body: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi criticised Congress for doing "politics" over the issue of Indian citizens stranded in Ukraine. "The government is making constant efforts to bring Indian students from Ukraine. On the other hand, Congress is doing politics in a crisis situation like this," Naqvi added. "It's nothing but stupidity," he stated.

384.title: 15-yr-old student dies after fight with classmates in school in Hyd
384.article_body: A 15-year-old student of class 10 of a private school died on Wednesday after a fight with classmates in Hyderabad, police said. The boy was allegedly hit by two of his classmates following an argument, police added. The victim had allegedly thrown a paper ball on one of his classmates which led to a fight, police further said.

385.title: Army jawan held in Thane for molesting foreign national on express train
385.article_body: An Army jawan has been arrested by railway police in Maharashtra's Thane district for allegedly molesting a foreign national on an express train. The accused has been identified as Sateesh T who hails from Kerala. Sateesh had allegedly molested a Portuguese woman who was travelling in Goa-Nizamuddin Express train between Kalyan and Kasara station in February 2019, the police said.

386.title: MMRDA conducts trial run for 'Make in India' metro rake between Aarey & Kurar
386.article_body: The MMRDA conducted a trial run for the first 'Make in India' metro rake on Phase 1 of Metro Line 7, between Aarey and Kurar, on Wednesday. Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray along with Urban Development Minister Eknath Shinde inspected the work. The metro line will be opened to the public once the MMRDA receives required certifications, an official said.

387.title: Women's team win Air Pistol event to secure India's 2nd gold at shooting WC
387.article_body: India won its second gold medal at the ongoing ISSF Shooting World Cup in Cairo after Esha Singh, P Nivetha and Ruchita Vinerkar won the women's 10 metre Air Pistol team event. The trio defeated Germany's Andrea Katharina Heckner, Sandra Reitz and Carina Wimmer 16-6 for the medal. Earlier, 19-year-old Saurabh Chaudhary won gold in men's 10 metre Air Pistol.

388.title: Journey from watching his films to directing him unbelievable: Nagraj on Big B
388.article_body: 'Jhund' director Nagraj Popatrao Manjule said that the journey of watching actor Amitabh Bachchan's films to directing him has been "unbelievable". "I even became a filmmaker incidentally. My team and I shoot very casually, but since Bachchan sir was around on sets of 'Jhund' while shooting so, we had to be disciplined," he added.

389.title: 148 IAF aircraft to demonstrate capabilities at exercise 'Vayu Shakti' in Pokhran
389.article_body: A total of 148 aircraft of the Indian Air Force (IAF) will demonstrate their full spectrum combat and fire capabilities during exercise 'Vayu Shakti' in Pokhran on March 7. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be the chief guest, a senior IAF official noted. For the first time, Rafale fighter jets will also participate in the exercise, the official added.

390.title: Can we direct Putin to stop war?: CJI as lawyer approaches SC over students' evacuation
390.article_body: After a lawyer approached Supreme Court seeking directions to government for the evacuation of Indian students stranded in Ukraine, a bench headed by Chief Justice of India NV Ramana said, "Government of India is doing its work to evacuate Indians." "We sympathise with the students...But can we direct Russia's President Putin to stop the war?" CJI Ramana said.

391.title: Missile strike on building captured on camera as Ukrainian man takes selfie video
391.article_body: A man in Ukraine's Kharkiv captured the moment when a missile fired by Russian soldiers hit a building. The man was recording a selfie video wherein he was asking for donations. After the missile hit the building, the man ran for safety. In the video, debris can be seen flying across the room he's filming in.

392.title: Tesla, Google, Apple & 5 other US stocks to begin trading on NSE IFSC today
392.article_body: The NSE International Financial Services Centre (IFSC) platform in Gujarat's GIFT City will start trading in eight US stocks from today. The stocks include Tesla, Amazon, Alphabet (Google), Apple, Meta Platforms (Facebook), Microsoft, Netflix and Walmart. To make US stocks accessible to Indians, market makers will buy shares in US and issue unsponsored depositary receipts against them, NSE said.

393.title: Haryana starts help desk at Mumbai airport for students back from Ukraine
393.article_body: The Haryana government has set up help desk at Mumbai airport to help students returning from Ukraine. "We are in constant touch with government to ensure that all Haryana students are back safely and will assist them in every possible way," an official statement said. The Haryana government help desk at Delhi airport is also helping students returning from Ukraine.

394.title: Reliance to invest ₹1,670 cr in Sanmina to make electronics in India
394.article_body: Reliance Industries will be investing ₹1,670 crore in a joint venture with US-listed Sanmina for making electronic products in India. Reliance will hold a 50.1% stake in the JV after the investment in Sanmina's existing Indian entity. The new entity will serve both domestic and export markets. It aims to make hardware for 5G communications, among other things.

395.title: Tamil Nadu girl held for raising anti-BJP slogans gets ₹2 lakh compensation
395.article_body: Tamil Nadu's State Human Rights Commission (SHRC) has ordered payment of ₹2 lakh as compensation to a Canada-based girl student from the state. The girl was arrested for raising anti-BJP government slogans on a flight in which the then BJP state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan was a co-passenger in 2018. "Money be recovered from police personnel who arrested her," SHRC ordered.

396.title: Putin will go for blood beyond Ukraine, he wants a new Russian empire: Ukraine
396.article_body: Andriy Yermak, the head of the Presidential Office of Ukraine, has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin will "go for blood beyond Ukraine", adding, "He must be stopped." He further said that Putin wants to create a new Russian empire. Russia's war with Ukraine "could be a prologue to a greater European or even global massacre", he stated.

397.title: This may be the last time you see me alive, Zelenskyy told EU leaders on video: Report
397.article_body: An EU official has told Reuters that Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's concluding message to EU leaders' online emergency summit after Russia began invasion was, "This may be the last time you see me alive." Dressed in army fatigues, Zelenskyy was reportedly speaking from a bunker. Another official said, "There was a stunned silence and some had tears in their eyes."

398.title: India focussed on 2 things, we urge India to take clear position: US on Russian invasion
398.article_body: The US administration is trying to urge India to take a "clear position" on the Russia-Ukraine crisis, US diplomat Donald Lu said. "India has focused on two things when trying to explain its position. The possibility of a diplomatic resolution of this conflict. The second thing that they emphasise is India has 18,000 students still in Ukraine," he added.

399.title: 4,800 Indian students to be evacuated from Romania by Friday: Scindia
399.article_body: Around 4,800 Indian students will be evacuated from Bucharest and Suceava in Romania through 24 flights between Wednesday and Friday amid the Russia-Ukraine war, Jyotiraditya Scindia, Union Minister for Civil Aviation, said. India has been evacuating its citizens through special flights from Ukraine's western neighbours. On Wednesday, Scindia interacted with the Indian students in Bucharest.

400.title: Hospitals in Ukraine running out of oxygen amid war: WHO
400.article_body: The WHO warned that hospitals in Ukraine are running out of oxygen supplies amid the ongoing war.  "Critical shortages of oxygen will...impact...the ability to treat patients with COVD-19 and...other conditions," WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said. "At least three major oxygen plants in Ukraine have now closed and we're seeking ways of accessing oxygen from neighbouring nations," he added.

401.title: Noida Police retains top spot across UP in 112 response for 8th month in row
401.article_body: The Gautam Buddh Nagar Police has bagged the top spot in Uttar Pradesh for the month of February in terms of response time to emergency calls on the 112 service, official data showed. The response time was at 6.32 minutes in February, as per the data. The district has retained top spot among 75 districts in UP since July 2021.

402.title: 4 arrested with unaccounted gold worth ₹16 crore on Konark Express
402.article_body: Four people were detained by Government Railway Police (GRP) on Mumbai-Bhubaneswar Konark Express on Wednesday. The GRP became suspicious of the movement of the four accused and checked their luggage. They seized 32 kg of unaccounted gold worth ₹16 crore from their possession. The accused couldn't produce valid GST documents of the seized gold jewellery during investigation, GRP official said.

403.title: 6,000 people fined ₹3.31 crore for not wearing helmets in Pune
403.article_body: A total of 6,000 people were fined in Pune for riding their two-wheelers without a helmet in the first two months of this year, officials said. A fine of ₹3.31 crore has been collected from the violators. According to reports, the Pune Police department had collected ₹90 crore in fines from 18 lakh helmet-less riders in 2021.
